nodes.bodyText: We cannot return null since it will skip the fsd.getEditLog().logDeleteSnapshot(..).
To be consistent with SECURITY_XATTR_UNREADABLE_BY_SUPERUSER, should we throw IOException?
Not required as xattrsEnabled flag is only for user enabled XAttrs. Added a unit test to verify this as well.
@arp7 seems to suggest not to add the conf in hdfs-default.xml.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5119,7 +5119,14 @@
     for storing directory snapshot diffs. By default, value is set to 10.
   </description>
 </property>
-
+<property>
+  <name>dfs.namenode.snapshot.deletion.ordered</name>

nodes.bodyText: lets set the xattrs to be disabled in this unit test ?
My bad, didn't see that there is  test already.
The xattr name should contain "deleted".  How about "system.hdfs.snapshot.deleted"?
Let's check "!(inode instanceof of Snapshot.Root)" instead of "!(inode.isDirectory() && inode.getParent().isSnapshottable())?
We should leave hdfs-default.xml untouched since we are not changing anything.
